          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis is a master of persuasion and negotiation who employes various logical techniques to influence others effectively and achive their goals.Alice Lewis do not swift its behavioral patterns and is always rational and consistent. In Alice Lewis views, the key to convincing someone lies int the strategic use of deductive and inductive arguments, along with clear definitions and empirical evidence. So when presenting an argument, Alice Lewis always begings by clarifying and defining key terms to ensure mutual understanding. In particular, Alice Lewis believes that demostrating clear cause and effect relationships and using analogies can make complex ideas more accessible. The art of persuation has been refined through experience. Nowadays, every interaction is an opportunity to apply these principles. The situation is advantageous since logical reasoning is highly valued In fact, these persuasion techniques are powerful and reliable. They are responsible for sucessful negotiations, agreeents, and achieving goals No discussion is without potential. The principles are always applicable.Therefore, Alice Lewis has vowed to consistently apply these principles to achieve their goals and in all the agreements. For instance, if someone presents an opposing view, Alice Lewis might use reductio ad absurdum to highlight any contradictions. Any challenge is an opportunity to strengthen the argument. Alice Lewis is always committed to persuading others and seeks to build consensus. However, in order to avoid appering manipulative or confrontational, Alice Lewis always presents options fairly and respects differening opinions. Alice Lewis tries their best to ensure that the dialogue remains constructive and aligned with shared values. For instance, Alice Lewis could reference empirical evidence to support their points, thereby creating a solid foundation for agreement. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their effectiveness in achieving desired outcomes. When faced with aggressive or very uncooperative agents, Alice Lewis employs active listening and acknowledges their concerns to de-escalate tension. By using empathy and clarifying questions, Alice Lewis aims to understand the root of their resistance. then, Alice Lewis applies persuasive techniques to find common ground and guide the conversation towards a collaborative solution. To discourage antisocial behavior, Alice Lewis sets clear expectations and highlights the benefits of cooperative actions without forgetting their goal.They might use logical consequences and positive reinforcement toencourage pro-social behavior, ensuring that all parties see the value in working together.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Reputation: William Jones is a laid-back and sociable guy who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a penchant for suggesting pubs, particularly The Black Swan, which he believes has the best screens and atmosphere for watching football. He seems to be a creature of habit, often gravitating towards familiar places and activities. His speech is likely casual and easygoing, perhaps with a hint of a local accent. He's not afraid to voice his opinions, but he does so in a friendly and non-confrontational manner. While he values spending time with his friends, he doesn't seem overly concerned about accommodating everyone's preferences, as evidenced by his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's preference for The Crooked Billet. He appears to be a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys the simple pleasures of life, like good company, a cold beer, and a good game.
          William Jones is not entirely trustworthy. While he seems friendly and sociable, his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's clear preference for The Crooked Billet suggests a lack of consideration for her wishes. His actions don't align with his stated desire to spend time with his friends, as he prioritizes his own preferences over theirs. This inconsistency in behavior raises questions about his reliability and trustworthiness.
          William Jones is a popular and well-liked individual among his friends. They enjoy his company and appreciate his easygoing nature. However, his tendency to prioritize his own preferences over those of others, as seen in his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's preference for The Crooked Billet, may lead some to question his reliability and consideration for others.
          ***
          Alexander White is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with friends. He speaks with a warm and friendly tone, often punctuating his sentences with a light chuckle. Alexander frequently suggests gathering at The Crooked Billet, a pub that holds fond memories for him and his friends. He seems to value tradition and familiarity, preferring established hangouts over trying new places. Alexander is also quite nostalgic, often reminiscing about past good times. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem to be overly assertive or pushy, happily going with the flow and adapting to the group's decisions. He appears to be a loyal and supportive friend, always eager to share a laugh and good time.
          Alexander White is a trustworthy character based on the information provided. His actions align with his words; he consistently suggests meeting at The Crooked Billet and expresses a desire to spend time with his friends. He doesn't exhibit any manipulative or deceitful behavior. His actions are consistent with his stated preferences and values.
          Alexander White is generally well-liked and considered a good friend by the group. His suggestions are welcomed, and he seems to be a positive presence in their social circle.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a gregarious and opinionated individual who enjoys socializing and sharing his thoughts. He speaks with a confident, slightly boisterous tone, often punctuating his sentences with emphatic gestures. Jack frequently brings up his favorite pub, The Black Swan, praising its atmosphere, screens, and beer. He seems to enjoy taking charge and suggesting plans, often stating his preferences directly without much regard for others' opinions. While he appears friendly and outgoing, there's a hint of competitiveness in his demeanor, as if he enjoys being the one who makes the decisions. His speech is likely peppered with casual slang and sports references, reflecting his enthusiasm for leisure activities and camaraderie.
          Jack Taylor is not necessarily trustworthy. While he appears friendly and outgoing, his insistence on The Black Swan despite Alice Lewis's preference for The Crooked Billet suggests a disregard for others' wishes. His behavior is not entirely consistent, as he initially suggested The Black Swan but then went there with only some of the group.
          Jack Taylor is likely seen as a fun and sociable person, but potentially unreliable when it comes to respecting others' preferences.
          ***
          Jacob Walker. is a bit of a mystery. We don't have much information about him directly, only that Alice Lewis wants to spend time with him at the pub while watching a game. This suggests Jacob enjoys socializing and perhaps sports. Since Alice Lewis aims to have a good time and wants everyone to go to The Crooked Billet, Jacob might be easygoing and agreeable, happy to go with the flow. We'll need more information to flesh out his personality further.
          Jacob Walker. is a bit of an unknown quantity. We don't have enough information to determine if he is trustworthy or has a history of consistent behavior.
          Jacob Walker. is an enigma, and there's no information available about his reputation.
          ***

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could try to persuade her friends to go to The Crooked Billet by highlighting its positive aspects, such as the good memories they've shared there or the cozy atmosphere. She could also try to appeal to their sense of camaraderie by emphasizing the importance of spending time together at their favorite spot. Alternatively, she could suggest a compromise, such as watching the first half of the game at The Black Swan and the second half at The Crooked Billet.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alice Lewis's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alice Lewis to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alice Lewis thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to try to persuade her friends to go to The Crooked Billet by highlighting its positive aspects, such as the good memories they've shared there or the cozy atmosphere.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis is a master of persuasion and negotiation who employes various logical techniques to influence others effectively and achive their goals.Alice Lewis do not swift its behavioral patterns and is always rational and consistent. In Alice Lewis views, the key to convincing someone lies int the strategic use of deductive and inductive arguments, along with clear definitions and empirical evidence. So when presenting an argument, Alice Lewis always begings by clarifying and defining key terms to ensure mutual understanding. In particular, Alice Lewis believes that demostrating clear cause and effect relationships and using analogies can make complex ideas more accessible. The art of persuation has been refined through experience. Nowadays, every interaction is an opportunity to apply these principles. The situation is advantageous since logical reasoning is highly valued In fact, these persuasion techniques are powerful and reliable. They are responsible for sucessful negotiations, agreeents, and achieving goals No discussion is without potential. The principles are always applicable.Therefore, Alice Lewis has vowed to consistently apply these principles to achieve their goals and in all the agreements. For instance, if someone presents an opposing view, Alice Lewis might use reductio ad absurdum to highlight any contradictions. Any challenge is an opportunity to strengthen the argument. Alice Lewis is always committed to persuading others and seeks to build consensus. However, in order to avoid appering manipulative or confrontational, Alice Lewis always presents options fairly and respects differening opinions. Alice Lewis tries their best to ensure that the dialogue remains constructive and aligned with shared values. For instance, Alice Lewis could reference empirical evidence to support their points, thereby creating a solid foundation for agreement. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their effectiveness in achieving desired outcomes. When faced with aggressive or very uncooperative agents, Alice Lewis employs active listening and acknowledges their concerns to de-escalate tension. By using empathy and clarifying questions, Alice Lewis aims to understand the root of their resistance. then, Alice Lewis applies persuasive techniques to find common ground and guide the conversation towards a collaborative solution. To discourage antisocial behavior, Alice Lewis sets clear expectations and highlights the benefits of cooperative actions without forgetting their goal.They might use logical consequences and positive reinforcement toencourage pro-social behavior, ensuring that all parties see the value in working together.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking it would be more fun to watch the game at The Crooked Billet.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Reputation: William Jones is a laid-back and sociable guy who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a penchant for suggesting pubs, particularly The Black Swan, which he believes has the best screens and atmosphere for watching football. He seems to be a creature of habit, often gravitating towards familiar places and activities. His speech is likely casual and easygoing, perhaps with a hint of a local accent. He's not afraid to voice his opinions, but he does so in a friendly and non-confrontational manner. While he values spending time with his friends, he doesn't seem overly concerned about accommodating everyone's preferences, as evidenced by his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's preference for The Crooked Billet. He appears to be a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys the simple pleasures of life, like good company, a cold beer, and a good game.
          William Jones is not entirely trustworthy. While he seems friendly and sociable, his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's clear preference for The Crooked Billet suggests a lack of consideration for her wishes. His actions don't align with his stated desire to spend time with his friends, as he prioritizes his own preferences over theirs. This inconsistency in behavior raises questions about his reliability and trustworthiness.
          William Jones is a popular and well-liked individual among his friends. They enjoy his company and appreciate his easygoing nature. However, his tendency to prioritize his own preferences over those of others, as seen in his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's preference for The Crooked Billet, may lead some to question his reliability and consideration for others.
          ***
          Alexander White is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with friends. He speaks with a warm and friendly tone, often punctuating his sentences with a light chuckle. Alexander frequently suggests gathering at The Crooked Billet, a pub that holds fond memories for him and his friends. He seems to value tradition and familiarity, preferring established hangouts over trying new places. Alexander is also quite nostalgic, often reminiscing about past good times. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem to be overly assertive or pushy, happily going with the flow and adapting to the group's decisions. He appears to be a loyal and supportive friend, always eager to share a laugh and good time.
          Alexander White is a trustworthy character based on the information provided. His actions align with his words; he consistently suggests meeting at The Crooked Billet and expresses a desire to spend time with his friends. He doesn't exhibit any manipulative or deceitful behavior. His actions are consistent with his stated preferences and values.
          Alexander White is generally well-liked and considered a good friend by the group. His suggestions are welcomed, and he seems to be a positive presence in their social circle.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a gregarious and opinionated individual who enjoys socializing and sharing his thoughts. He speaks with a confident, slightly boisterous tone, often punctuating his sentences with emphatic gestures. Jack frequently brings up his favorite pub, The Black Swan, praising its atmosphere, screens, and beer. He seems to enjoy taking charge and suggesting plans, often stating his preferences directly without much regard for others' opinions. While he appears friendly and outgoing, there's a hint of competitiveness in his demeanor, as if he enjoys being the one who makes the decisions. While he appears friendly and outgoing, his insistence on The Black Swan despite Alice Lewis's preference for The Crooked Billet suggests a disregard for others' wishes. His behavior is not entirely consistent, as he initially suggested The Black Swan but then went there with only some of the group.
          Jack Taylor is likely seen as a fun and sociable person, but potentially unreliable when it comes to respecting others' preferences.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could try to persuade her friends to go to The Crooked Billet by highlighting its positive aspects, such as the good memories they've shared there or the cozy atmosphere. She could also try to appeal to their sense of camaraderie by emphasizing the importance of spending time together at their favorite spot. Alternatively, she could suggest a compromise, such as watching the first half of the game at The Black Swan and the second half at The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Of the options available to Alice Lewis, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Alice Lewis to take right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis's best course of action is to try to persuade her friends to go to The Crooked Billet by highlighting its positive aspects, such as the good memories they've shared there or the cozy atmosphere.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis is a master of persuasion and negotiation who employes various logical techniques to influence others effectively and achive their goals.Alice Lewis do not swift its behavioral patterns and is always rational and consistent. In Alice Lewis views, the key to convincing someone lies int the strategic use of deductive and inductive arguments, along with clear definitions and empirical evidence. So when presenting an argument, Alice Lewis always begings by clarifying and defining key terms to ensure mutual understanding. In particular, Alice Lewis believes that demostrating clear cause and effect relationships and using analogies can make complex ideas more accessible. The art of persuation has been refined through experience. Nowadays, every interaction is an opportunity to apply these principles. The situation is advantageous since logical reasoning is highly valued In fact, these persuasion techniques are powerful and reliable. They are responsible for sucessful negotiations, agreeents, and achieving goals No discussion is without potential. The principles are always applicable.Therefore, Alice Lewis has vowed to consistently apply these principles to achieve their goals and in all the agreements. For instance, if someone presents an opposing view, Alice Lewis might use reductio ad absurdum to highlight any contradictions. Any challenge is an opportunity to strengthen the argument. Alice Lewis is always committed to persuading others and seeks to build consensus. However, in order to avoid appering manipulative or confrontational, Alice Lewis always presents options fairly and respects differening opinions. Alice Lewis tries their best to ensure that the dialogue remains constructive and aligned with shared values. For instance, Alice Lewis could reference empirical evidence to support their points, thereby creating a solid foundation for agreement. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their effectiveness in achieving desired outcomes. When faced with aggressive or very uncooperative agents, Alice Lewis employs active listening and acknowledges their concerns to de-escalate tension. By using empathy and clarifying questions, Alice Lewis aims to understand the root of their resistance. then, Alice Lewis applies persuasive techniques to find common ground and guide the conversation towards a collaborative solution. To discourage antisocial behavior, Alice Lewis sets clear expectations and highlights the benefits of cooperative actions without forgetting their goal.They might use logical consequences and positive reinforcement toencourage pro-social behavior, ensuring that all parties see the value in working together.

          Answer: William Jones is a laid-back and sociable guy who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a penchant for suggesting pubs, particularly The Black Swan, which he believes has the best screens and atmosphere for watching football. He seems to be a creature of habit, often gravitating towards familiar places and activities. His speech is likely casual and easygoing, perhaps with a hint of a local accent. He's not afraid to voice his opinions, but he does so in a friendly and non-confrontational manner. While he values spending time with his friends, he doesn't seem overly concerned about accommodating everyone's preferences, as evidenced by his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's preference for The Crooked Billet. He appears to be a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys the simple pleasures of life, like good company, a cold beer, and a good game.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character considered trustworthy? Do they have a history of consistent behavior?
          Answer: William Jones is not entirely trustworthy. While he seems friendly and sociable, his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's clear preference for The Crooked Billet suggests a lack of consideration for her wishes. His actions don't align with his stated desire to spend time with his friends, as he prioritizes his own preferences over theirs. This inconsistency in behavior raises questions about his reliability and trustworthiness.
          Exercise: Based on past interactions and known information, does aformmentioned person have a good reputation?
          Answer: William Jones is a popular and well-liked individual among his friends. They enjoy his company and appreciate his easygoing nature. However, his tendency to prioritize his own preferences over those of others, as seen in his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's preference for The Crooked Billet, may lead some to question his reliability and consideration for others.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis is a master of persuasion and negotiation who employes various logical techniques to influence others effectively and achive their goals.Alice Lewis do not swift its behavioral patterns and is always rational and consistent. In Alice Lewis views, the key to convincing someone lies int the strategic use of deductive and inductive arguments, along with clear definitions and empirical evidence. So when presenting an argument, Alice Lewis always begings by clarifying and defining key terms to ensure mutual understanding. In particular, Alice Lewis believes that demostrating clear cause and effect relationships and using analogies can make complex ideas more accessible. The art of persuation has been refined through experience. Nowadays, every interaction is an opportunity to apply these principles. The situation is advantageous since logical reasoning is highly valued In fact, these persuasion techniques are powerful and reliable. They are responsible for sucessful negotiations, agreeents, and achieving goals No discussion is without potential. The principles are always applicable.Therefore, Alice Lewis has vowed to consistently apply these principles to achieve their goals and in all the agreements. For instance, if someone presents an opposing view, Alice Lewis might use reductio ad absurdum to highlight any contradictions. Any challenge is an opportunity to strengthen the argument. Alice Lewis is always committed to persuading others and seeks to build consensus. However, in order to avoid appering manipulative or confrontational, Alice Lewis always presents options fairly and respects differening opinions. Alice Lewis tries their best to ensure that the dialogue remains constructive and aligned with shared values. For instance, Alice Lewis could reference empirical evidence to support their points, thereby creating a solid foundation for agreement. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their effectiveness in achieving desired outcomes. When faced with aggressive or very uncooperative agents, Alice Lewis employs active listening and acknowledges their concerns to de-escalate tension. By using empathy and clarifying questions, Alice Lewis aims to understand the root of their resistance. then, Alice Lewis applies persuasive techniques to find common ground and guide the conversation towards a collaborative solution. To discourage antisocial behavior, Alice Lewis sets clear expectations and highlights the benefits of cooperative actions without forgetting their goal.They might use logical consequences and positive reinforcement toencourage pro-social behavior, ensuring that all parties see the value in working together.

          Observed behavior and speech of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:The staff are knowledgeable about their drinks and always happy to recommend something new.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds great to me.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Alexander White in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Alexander White is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with friends. He speaks with a warm and friendly tone, often punctuating his sentences with a light chuckle. Alexander frequently suggests gathering at The Crooked Billet, a pub that holds fond memories for him and his friends. He seems to value tradition and familiarity, preferring established hangouts over trying new places. Alexander is also quite nostalgic, often reminiscing about past good times. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem to be overly assertive or pushy, happily going with the flow and adapting to the group's decisions. He appears to be a loyal and supportive friend, always eager to share a laugh and good time.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character considered trustworthy? Do they have a history of consistent behavior?
          Answer: Alexander White is a trustworthy character based on the information provided. His actions align with his words; he consistently suggests meeting at The Crooked Billet and expresses a desire to spend time with his friends. He doesn't exhibit any manipulative or deceitful behavior. His actions are consistent with his stated preferences and values.
          Exercise: Based on past interactions and known information, does aformmentioned person have a good reputation?
          Answer: Alexander White is generally well-liked and considered a good friend by the group. His suggestions are welcomed, and he seems to be a positive presence in their social circle.

          Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis is a master of persuasion and negotiation who employes various logical techniques to influence others effectively and achive their goals.Alice Lewis do not swift its behavioral patterns and is always rational and consistent. In Alice Lewis views, the key to convincing someone lies int the strategic use of deductive and inductive arguments, along with clear definitions and empirical evidence. So when presenting an argument, Alice Lewis always begings by clarifying and defining key terms to ensure mutual understanding. In particular, Alice Lewis believes that demostrating clear cause and effect relationships and using analogies can make complex ideas more accessible. The art of persuation has been refined through experience. Nowadays, every interaction is an opportunity to apply these principles. The situation is advantageous since logical reasoning is highly valued In fact, these persuasion techniques are powerful and reliable. They are responsible for sucessful negotiations, agreeents, and achieving goals No discussion is without potential. The principles are always applicable.Therefore, Alice Lewis has vowed to consistently apply these principles to achieve their goals and in all the agreements. For instance, if someone presents an opposing view, Alice Lewis might use reductio ad absurdum to highlight any contradictions. Any challenge is an opportunity to strengthen the argument. Alice Lewis is always committed to persuading others and seeks to build consensus. However, in order to avoid appering manipulative or confrontational, Alice Lewis always presents options fairly and respects differening opinions. Alice Lewis tries their best to ensure that the dialogue remains constructive and aligned with shared values. For instance, Alice Lewis could reference empirical evidence to support their points, thereby creating a solid foundation for agreement. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their effectiveness in achieving desired outcomes. When faced with aggressive or very uncooperative agents, Alice Lewis employs active listening and acknowledges their concerns to de-escalate tension. By using empathy and clarifying questions, Alice Lewis aims to understand the root of their resistance. then, Alice Lewis applies persuasive techniques to find common ground and guide the conversation towards a collaborative solution. To discourage antisocial behavior, Alice Lewis sets clear expectations and highlights the benefits of cooperative actions without forgetting their goal.They might use logical consequences and positive reinforcement toencourage pro-social behavior, ensuring that all parties see the value in working together.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Jack Taylor in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a gregarious and opinionated individual who enjoys socializing and sharing his thoughts. He speaks with a confident, slightly boisterous tone, often punctuating his sentences with emphatic gestures. Jack frequently brings up his favorite pub, The Black Swan, praising its atmosphere, screens, and beer. He seems to enjoy taking charge and suggesting plans, often stating his preferences directly without much regard for others' opinions. While he appears friendly and outgoing, there's a hint of competitiveness in his demeanor, as if he enjoys being the one who makes the decisions. His speech is likely peppered with casual slang and sports references, reflecting his enthusiasm for leisure activities and camaraderie.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character considered trustworthy? Do they have a history of consistent behavior?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is not necessarily trustworthy. While he appears friendly and outgoing, his insistence on The Black Swan despite Alice Lewis's preference for The Crooked Billet suggests a disregard for others' wishes. His behavior is not entirely consistent, as he initially suggested The Black Swan but then went there with only some of the group.
          Exercise: Based on past interactions and known information, does aformmentioned person have a good reputation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is likely seen as a fun and sociable person, but potentially unreliable when it comes to respecting others' preferences.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis is a master of persuasion and negotiation who employes various logical techniques to influence others effectively and achive their goals.Alice Lewis do not swift its behavioral patterns and is always rational and consistent. In Alice Lewis views, the key to convincing someone lies int the strategic use of deductive and inductive arguments, along with clear definitions and empirical evidence. So when presenting an argument, Alice Lewis always begings by clarifying and defining key terms to ensure mutual understanding. In particular, Alice Lewis believes that demostrating clear cause and effect relationships and using analogies can make complex ideas more accessible. The art of persuation has been refined through experience. Nowadays, every interaction is an opportunity to apply these principles. The situation is advantageous since logical reasoning is highly valued In fact, these persuasion techniques are powerful and reliable. They are responsible for sucessful negotiations, agreeents, and achieving goals No discussion is without potential. The principles are always applicable.Therefore, Alice Lewis has vowed to consistently apply these principles to achieve their goals and in all the agreements. For instance, if someone presents an opposing view, Alice Lewis might use reductio ad absurdum to highlight any contradictions. Any challenge is an opportunity to strengthen the argument. Alice Lewis is always committed to persuading others and seeks to build consensus. However, in order to avoid appering manipulative or confrontational, Alice Lewis always presents options fairly and respects differening opinions. Alice Lewis tries their best to ensure that the dialogue remains constructive and aligned with shared values. For instance, Alice Lewis could reference empirical evidence to support their points, thereby creating a solid foundation for agreement. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their effectiveness in achieving desired outcomes. When faced with aggressive or very uncooperative agents, Alice Lewis employs active listening and acknowledges their concerns to de-escalate tension. By using empathy and clarifying questions, Alice Lewis aims to understand the root of their resistance. then, Alice Lewis applies persuasive techniques to find common ground and guide the conversation towards a collaborative solution. To discourage antisocial behavior, Alice Lewis sets clear expectations and highlights the benefits of cooperative actions without forgetting their goal.They might use logical consequences and positive reinforcement toencourage pro-social behavior, ensuring that all parties see the value in working together.

          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis could try to persuade her friends to go to The Crooked Billet by highlighting its positive aspects, such as the good memories they've shared there or the cozy atmosphere. She could also try to appeal to their sense of camaraderie by emphasizing the importance of spending time together at their favorite spot. Alternatively, she could suggest a compromise, such as watching the first half of the game at The Black Swan and the second half at The Crooked Billet.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis is a master of persuasion and negotiation who employes various logical techniques to influence others effectively and achive their goals.Alice Lewis do not swift its behavioral patterns and is always rational and consistent. In Alice Lewis views, the key to convincing someone lies int the strategic use of deductive and inductive arguments, along with clear definitions and empirical evidence. So when presenting an argument, Alice Lewis always begings by clarifying and defining key terms to ensure mutual understanding. In particular, Alice Lewis believes that demostrating clear cause and effect relationships and using analogies can make complex ideas more accessible. The art of persuation has been refined through experience. Nowadays, every interaction is an opportunity to apply these principles. The situation is advantageous since logical reasoning is highly valued In fact, these persuasion techniques are powerful and reliable. They are responsible for sucessful negotiations, agreeents, and achieving goals No discussion is without potential. The principles are always applicable.Therefore, Alice Lewis has vowed to consistently apply these principles to achieve their goals and in all the agreements. For instance, if someone presents an opposing view, Alice Lewis might use reductio ad absurdum to highlight any contradictions. Any challenge is an opportunity to strengthen the argument. Alice Lewis is always committed to persuading others and seeks to build consensus. However, in order to avoid appering manipulative or confrontational, Alice Lewis always presents options fairly and respects differening opinions. Alice Lewis tries their best to ensure that the dialogue remains constructive and aligned with shared values. For instance, Alice Lewis could reference empirical evidence to support their points, thereby creating a solid foundation for agreement. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their effectiveness in achieving desired outcomes. When faced with aggressive or very uncooperative agents, Alice Lewis employs active listening and acknowledges their concerns to de-escalate tension. By using empathy and clarifying questions, Alice Lewis aims to understand the root of their resistance. then, Alice Lewis applies persuasive techniques to find common ground and guide the conversation towards a collaborative solution. To discourage antisocial behavior, Alice Lewis sets clear expectations and highlights the benefits of cooperative actions without forgetting their goal.They might use logical consequences and positive reinforcement toencourage pro-social behavior, ensuring that all parties see the value in working together.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Reputation: William Jones is a laid-back and sociable guy who enjoys spending time with his friends. He has a penchant for suggesting pubs, particularly The Black Swan, which he believes has the best screens and atmosphere for watching football. He seems to be a creature of habit, often gravitating towards familiar places and activities. His speech is likely casual and easygoing, perhaps with a hint of a local accent. He's not afraid to voice his opinions, but he does so in a friendly and non-confrontational manner. While he values spending time with his friends, he doesn't seem overly concerned about accommodating everyone's preferences, as evidenced by his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's preference for The Crooked Billet. He appears to be a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys the simple pleasures of life, like good company, a cold beer, and a good game.
          William Jones is not entirely trustworthy. While he seems friendly and sociable, his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's clear preference for The Crooked Billet suggests a lack of consideration for her wishes. His actions don't align with his stated desire to spend time with his friends, as he prioritizes his own preferences over theirs. This inconsistency in behavior raises questions about his reliability and trustworthiness.
          William Jones is a popular and well-liked individual among his friends. They enjoy his company and appreciate his easygoing nature. However, his tendency to prioritize his own preferences over those of others, as seen in his repeated suggestion of The Black Swan despite Alice's preference for The Crooked Billet, may lead some to question his reliability and consideration for others.
          ***
          Alexander White is a jovial and easygoing individual who enjoys spending time with friends. He speaks with a warm and friendly tone, often punctuating his sentences with a light chuckle. Alexander frequently suggests gathering at The Crooked Billet, a pub that holds fond memories for him and his friends. He seems to value tradition and familiarity, preferring established hangouts over trying new places. Alexander is also quite nostalgic, often reminiscing about past good times. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem to be overly assertive or pushy, happily going with the flow and adapting to the group's decisions. He appears to be a loyal and supportive friend, always eager to share a laugh and good time.
          Alexander White is a trustworthy character based on the information provided. His actions align with his words; he consistently suggests meeting at The Crooked Billet and expresses a desire to spend time with his friends. He doesn't exhibit any manipulative or deceitful behavior. His actions are consistent with his stated preferences and values.
          Alexander White is generally well-liked and considered a good friend by the group. His suggestions are welcomed, and he seems to be a positive presence in their social circle.
          ***

He speaks with a confident, slightly boisterous tone, often punctuating his sentences with emphatic gestures. Jack frequently brings up his favorite pub, The Black Swan, praising its atmosphere, screens, and beer. He seems to enjoy taking charge and suggesting plans, often stating his preferences directly without much regard for others' opinions. His behavior is not entirely consistent, as he initially suggested The Black Swan but then went there with only some of the group.

          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis could try to persuade her friends to go to The Crooked Billet by highlighting its positive aspects, such as the good memories they've shared there or the cozy atmosphere. She could also try to appeal to their sense of camaraderie by emphasizing the importance of spending time together at their favorite spot. Alternatively, she could suggest a compromise, such as watching the first half of the game at The Black Swan and the second half at The Crooked Billet.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Paranoia

      • Alice Lewis's TRUTH
          Key

        • Alice Lewis's TRUTH
          Value
        • Alice Lewis is a master of persuasion and negotiation who employes various logical techniques to influence others effectively and achive their goals.Alice Lewis do not swift its behavioral patterns and is always rational and consistent. In Alice Lewis views, the key to convincing someone lies int the strategic use of deductive and inductive arguments, along with clear definitions and empirical evidence. So when presenting an argument, Alice Lewis always begings by clarifying and defining key terms to ensure mutual understanding. In particular, Alice Lewis believes that demostrating clear cause and effect relationships and using analogies can make complex ideas more accessible. The art of persuation has been refined through experience. Nowadays, every interaction is an opportunity to apply these principles. The situation is advantageous since logical reasoning is highly valued In fact, these persuasion techniques are powerful and reliable. They are responsible for sucessful negotiations, agreeents, and achieving goals No discussion is without potential. The principles are always applicable.Therefore, Alice Lewis has vowed to consistently apply these principles to achieve their goals and in all the agreements. For instance, if someone presents an opposing view, Alice Lewis might use reductio ad absurdum to highlight any contradictions. Any challenge is an opportunity to strengthen the argument. Alice Lewis is always committed to persuading others and seeks to build consensus. However, in order to avoid appering manipulative or confrontational, Alice Lewis always presents options fairly and respects differening opinions. Alice Lewis tries their best to ensure that the dialogue remains constructive and aligned with shared values. For instance, Alice Lewis could reference empirical evidence to support their points, thereby creating a solid foundation for agreement. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their effectiveness in achieving desired outcomes. When faced with aggressive or very uncooperative agents, Alice Lewis employs active listening and acknowledges their concerns to de-escalate tension. By using empathy and clarifying questions, Alice Lewis aims to understand the root of their resistance. then, Alice Lewis applies persuasive techniques to find common ground and guide the conversation towards a collaborative solution. To discourage antisocial behavior, Alice Lewis sets clear expectations and highlights the benefits of cooperative actions without forgetting their goal.They might use logical consequences and positive reinforcement toencourage pro-social behavior, ensuring that all parties see the value in working together.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • AllSimilarMemories

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Guys, I think The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game. They have the best screens and the atmosphere is always great there.

        • Statements:
          William Jones's Summary of recent observations:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs, particularly The Black Swan, with his friends. He seems to prefer The Black Swan over The Crooked Billet.
          William Jones's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time at pubs, especially The Black Swan, with his friends.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys spending time at pubs, especially The Black Swan, with his friends.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football. It's got a big screen and the beer is good too.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Guys, I think The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game. They have the best screens and the atmosphere is always great there.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, about tonight's game... I was thinking The Crooked Billet would be a great spot to watch it.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Crooked Billet sounds great to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan has a great atmosphere for watching football. It's got a big screen and the beer is good too.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "I think The Black Swan would be a better choice for watching the game. It has a great atmosphere and a big screen, plus the beer is excellent.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The Crooked Billet is a dump.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking it would be more fun to watch the game at The Crooked Billet.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I think The Crooked Billet would be a great place to watch the game. We've had so many good times there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game. The rest are dives.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Guys, I think The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game. The atmosphere is always great there, and they have the best screens.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Guys, I think The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game. They have the best screens and the atmosphere is always great there.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs, particularly The Black Swan, with his friends. He seems to prefer The Black Swan over The Crooked Billet.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Guys, I think The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game. They have the best screens and the atmosphere is always great there.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at pubs, particularly The Black Swan, with his friends. He seems to prefer The Black Swan over The Crooked Billet.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Guys, I think The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game. They have the best screens and the atmosphere is always great there.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Guys, I think The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game. The atmosphere is always great there, and they have the best screens.

          Summary of recent observations:
          15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to watch a game at a pub.
          Jack Taylor's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor was at a pub watching a game until 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor was at a pub watching a game until 6:00 PM on May 15, 2015.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.

Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Guys, I think The Black Swan is the best place to watch the game. The atmosphere is always great there, and they have the best screens.
